intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. triangulariforme, commonly known as the triangular leaf groundsel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
